content:
• Thursday, September 29, 2011
  • ORN

    Orion Marine (NYSE:ORN) gives an investor update, saying that its end markets have experienced...

    Orion Marine (NYSE:ORN) gives an investor update, saying that its end markets have experienced "uncertain and tough times," and anemic GDP growth and delays in federal spending will continue to put pressure on margins for the foreseeable future. Shares -12% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:05 PM
  • XRTX

    Xyratex (NASDAQ:XRTX), a maker of enterprise storage subsystems, is down 2.7% AH after reporting...

    Xyratex (NASDAQ:XRTX), a maker of enterprise storage subsystems, is down 2.7% AH after reporting FQ3 results. While revenue of $361.8M (-16% Y/Y) and EPS of $0.42 beat consensus by $10.7M and $0.24, its FQ4 revenue guidance of $343M-$383M and EPS guidance of $0.27-$0.45 fall short of a consensus of $388.4M and $0.50. (previously)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:31 PM
  • HRBN

    Harbin Electric (NASDAQ:HRBN), a Chinese maker of electric motors, is up 8.1% AH after stating...

    Harbin Electric (NASDAQ:HRBN), a Chinese maker of electric motors, is up 8.1% AH after stating it's begun mailing proxy materials regarding a vote to take the company private for $24/share in cash - a 25% premium to today's closing price. Harbin shares have been volatile thanks to fraud accusations and fears of the aforementioned deal not occurring.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:20 PM | 1 Comment
  • MU

    More on Micron's (NASDAQ:MU) FQ4 results: Gross margin was 15%, down from 22% in FQ3 and 31% in...

    More on Micron's (NASDAQ:MU) FQ4 results: Gross margin was 15%, down from 22% in FQ3 and 31% in year-ago period, due to falling DRAM prices. DRAM sales declined 12% Q/Q, while sales of NAND flash memory increased 11%. Free cash flow was -$574M for quarter, and -$66M for FY11. MU -3.4% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:30 PM
  • FOSL

    Shares of Fossil (FOSL -7%) were hit hard today after Piper Jaffray cut its price target to $105...

    Shares of Fossil (FOSL -7%) were hit hard today after Piper Jaffray cut its price target to $105 from $146, citing a deterioration in consumer confidence and potential discretionary spending reductions in Europe.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:23 PM
  • CRZO

    Carrizo Oil & Gas (NASDAQ:CRZO) finishes the day +8.2% higher after GAIL India says it will...

    Carrizo Oil & Gas (NASDAQ:CRZO) finishes the day +8.2% higher after GAIL India says it will buy a 20% stake in the company for $95M.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:07 PM | 1 Comment
  • NFLX

    Netflix's (NFLX -11%) massive selloff today has plenty of investors baffled. But ever-bearish...

    Netflix's (NFLX -11%) massive selloff today has plenty of investors baffled. But ever-bearish Tony Wible believes it has much to do with investors realizing the unlikelihood of an Amazon (NASDAQ:AMZN) acquisition, as well as a general fear of subscriber losses. Wible also thinks Amazon is just one of many competitors that will go after Netflix via subsidized pricing.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:54 PM | 5 Comments
  • MOS

    Mosaic's (MOS -5.5%) FQ1 jumped 77%, but its outlook for potash pricing was disappointing, and...

    Mosaic's (MOS -5.5%) FQ1 jumped 77%, but its outlook for potash pricing was disappointing, and could also have implications for Potash (POT -0.7%), Susquehanna says. The pricing of the key fertilizer ingredient could be due to an increase in shipments to India after a stalemate between the country and potash producers was broken.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:46 PM
  • BB

    Although Research In Motion (RIMM -5.1%) denies the report that it's dumping the Playbook, the...

    Although Research In Motion (RIMM -5.1%) denies the report that it's dumping the Playbook, the analyst drew his conclusion because a Playbook facility had laid off lots of workers. Plus, Best Buy (NYSE:BBY) is slashing prices, bringing to mind what H-P did with the Touchpad, OptionMonster's Jon Najarian says. And after Amazon's (NASDAQ:AMZN) move, the RIMs of the world had little choice.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:17 PM | 2 Comments
  • FCX

    Freeport-McMoRan Copper & Gold (FCX -3.6%) is lower today after workers at its Peruvian...

    Freeport-McMoRan Copper & Gold (FCX -3.6%) is lower today after workers at its Peruvian Cerro Verde copper mine went on strike this morning. Cerro Verde, of which Freeport-McMoRan has a majority interest, is Peru's third largest copper mine, producing over 345M pounds of copper in the first half of this year alone.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:33 PM | 2 Comments
  • UAL

    United Continental (UAL -2.7%) gets a federal judge's go-ahead to combine flight operations of...

    United Continental (UAL -2.7%) gets a federal judge's go-ahead to combine flight operations of its two disparate airlines tomorrow, despite objections from United pilots who says they haven't gotten enough training on new procedures. Pilots are arguing a safety issue, though UAL says its training was developed with FAA consultation.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:31 PM
  • AMD

    New pessimism surrounding China may be helping to sink stocks, as the Dow and S&P join...

    New pessimism surrounding China may be helping to sink stocks, as the Dow and S&P join Nasdaq in the red. Two key movers: The Justice Department is investigating U.S.-traded Chinese stocks, and investors expect growth in China to fall below 5% within five years. Techs have been down big all day, dragged lower by AMD -16.3%, NFLX -13.9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:15 PM | 1 Comment
  • TIF

    Shares of Tiffany (TIF -10.4%) and Coach (COH -9.4%) get hammered after a Bloomberg survey...

    Shares of Tiffany (TIF -10.4%) and Coach (COH -9.4%) get hammered after a Bloomberg survey indicates growth in China - key to luxury retailers like TIF and COH - may slow significantly.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:05 PM | 1 Comment
  • DRQ

    Rig supplier Dril-Quip (DRQ -1.5%) is lower today after JP Morgan cut the shares to neutral from...

    Rig supplier Dril-Quip (DRQ -1.5%) is lower today after JP Morgan cut the shares to neutral from overweight, citing concerns over a Gulf of Mexico recovery.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:01 PM
  • GMCR

    Today is National Coffee Day, and what better way to celebrate than to check in on the...

    Today is National Coffee Day, and what better way to celebrate than to check in on the performance of five coffee stocks taking advantage of Americans' 400M cup-a-day addiction (slideshow) to the drink and the chains that serve it. YTD returns: GMCR +200%, JVA +133%, PEET +34%, CBOU +24%, SBUX +22%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:56 PM | 2 Comments
  • MU

    Micron (MU -6.1%) is selling off ahead of its FQ4 report, due after the close, as investors fear...

    Micron (MU -6.1%) is selling off ahead of its FQ4 report, due after the close, as investors fear soft PC demand and a weaker DRAM pricing will ding the company's numbers. Deutsche Bank thinks Micron will have free cash flow of -$400M for the quarter, thanks to $900M in capex, and Wedbush is worried a recent spike in DRAM spot prices will prove short-lived.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:53 PM
  • RLD

    3D glasses vendor RealD (RLD -7.3%) adds to yesterday's losses after the LA Times reports "at...

    3D glasses vendor RealD (RLD -7.3%) adds to yesterday's losses after the LA Times reports "at least one other studio" could join Sony (NYSE:SNE) in refusing to pay theater owners for 3D glasses, and "several others" were hoping Sony would succeed in its efforts. IMAX, which plays numerous 3D films at its theaters, is down 6.1%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:39 PM
  • XOM

    Exxon Mobil (XOM +2.3%) trades higher after saying its U.S. marine subsidiary, SeaRiver...

    Exxon Mobil (XOM +2.3%) trades higher after saying its U.S. marine subsidiary, SeaRiver Maritime, signs a $400M contract with the Philadelphia Shipyard to construct two new tankers. The job is expected to create more than 1,000 new jobs over the two-year construction period.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:34 PM
  • CB

    Chubb (CB +2.1%) is higher today, after the company says its Q3 pretax catastrophe losses would...

    Chubb (CB +2.1%) is higher today, after the company says its Q3 pretax catastrophe losses would range between $400M - $475M, in line with projections. The the bulk of those losses, around $300M - $375M, were due to Hurricane Irene.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:19 PM
  • AEG

    AEGON (AEG +4.1%) trades higher after announcing plans to restructure its Dutch business,...

    AEGON (AEG +4.1%) trades higher after announcing plans to restructure its Dutch business, resulting in a reduced cost base for its Netherlands operations by €100M compared to last year. Most of the cost savings are expected to be realized in 2012.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:56 PM
  • YNDX

    TechCrunch reports startup search engine Blekko kicks up a $30M investment from Yandex (YNDX...

    TechCrunch reports startup search engine Blekko kicks up a $30M investment from Yandex (YNDX -2.2%), helping land its CEO, Arkady Volozh, on Blekko's board. It's an interesting move from the Russian search engine - still reeling from an ill-fated meeting with hedge funds yesterday - that lines it up to compete in the U.S. market with Google (GOOG +0.2%) if Blekko can actually turn rave reviews into significant levels of search traffic.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:50 PM
  • BB

    Shares of Research in Motion (RIMM -2.7%) are down after Collins Stewart analyst John Vinh...

    Shares of Research in Motion (RIMM -2.7%) are down after Collins Stewart analyst John Vinh commented this morning that he thinks the company has stopped producing its PlayBook and is looking to exit the tablet market. RIM denies the report, calling it "pure fiction."

     
     
     
     
    | 12:36 PM | 5 Comments
  • OKE

    Oneok (OKS +4%) pops after Credit Suisse ups the shares to Outperform, saying the company has...

    Oneok (OKS +4%) pops after Credit Suisse ups the shares to Outperform, saying the company has "under-appreciated organic growth and leverage to favorable NGL fundamentals."

     
     
     
     
    | 12:32 PM
  • GM

    S&P bumps up its credit rating on General Motors (GM +1.3%) by two notches, latching on to...

    S&P bumps up its credit rating on General Motors (GM +1.3%) by two notches, latching on to the newly ratified contract with the UAW as a driver for profitability and raising its outllook. "GM has a two-year track record of profits and cash flow generation in its global automotive operations, supported by strong performance in North America," notes the ratings agency.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:32 PM | 2 Comments
  • KZ

    Chinese mobile entertainment company KongZhong (KONG +5%) jumps after its board authorizes a...

    Chinese mobile entertainment company KongZhong (KONG +5%) jumps after its board authorizes a buyback of up to $15M of its ADR's.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:27 PM
  • QGEN

    Shares of Qiagen NV (QGEN +3%) are up today after Leerink Swann raises it to outperform on...

    Shares of Qiagen NV (QGEN +3%) are up today after Leerink Swann raises it to outperform on valuation, winning out over a same-day competitor downgrade of the shares to neutral by Mizuho.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:24 PM
  • RIGL

    Rigel Pharmaceuticals (RIGL +4.5%) is up on the day after JP Morgan initiates coverage with an...

    Rigel Pharmaceuticals (RIGL +4.5%) is up on the day after JP Morgan initiates coverage with an overweight. The firm says Rigel's rheumatoid arthritis Fostamatinib shows a lot of promise and the stock will likely gaing in anticipation of positive results.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:06 PM
  • NFLX

    Big tech momentum names are down in big chunks without much news to explain it, but Mark...

    Big tech momentum names are down in big chunks without much news to explain it, but Mark Gongloff tries: "Are hedge funds dumping to raise cash, or are portfolio managers doing some quarter-end shuffling? Maybe a bit of both." Netflix (NFLX -8.9%) continues its beatdown, now -49% this month. AAPL -0.5%, AMZN -1.9%, PCLN -3.9%, BIDU -6.5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:03 PM | 1 Comment
  • YOKU

    Piper Jaffray comments on the DoJ investigation into Chinese firms, saying the probe likely puts...

    Piper Jaffray comments on the DoJ investigation into Chinese firms, saying the probe likely puts smaller companies like Youku.com (YOKU -12%), Sky-mobi (MOBI -6.7%), and Dangdang (DANG -1.1%) at risk, given they do not have proven track records. The firm says SINA (SINA -8%), and Baidu (BIDU -6%) should be less affected.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:53 AM
  • DPS-OLD

    Dr. Pepper Snapple (DPS-OLD +3.3%) outperforms the market and gains a nod from an analyst on...

    Dr. Pepper Snapple (DPS-OLD +3.3%) outperforms the market and gains a nod from an analyst on CNBC (video). Quietly, shares of DPS-OLD have outgained KO and PEP this year, registering a 7.7% gain vs 5.1% and -4% respectively for its rivals.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:52 AM
  • UMPQ

    Umpqua Holdings (UMPQ +8.4%) pops after its board approves an increase in its share buyback to...

    Umpqua Holdings (UMPQ +8.4%) pops after its board approves an increase in its share buyback to 15M shares, which is approximately 13% of the bank holding company's float.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:46 AM
  • NUVA

    Medical device company NuVasive (NUVA -9.4%) trades off today after it agrees to buy privately...

    Medical device company NuVasive (NUVA -9.4%) trades off today after it agrees to buy privately held Impulse Monitoring, a provider of monitoring services during surgeries, for $80M in cash and stock.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:28 AM
  • KODK

    Shares of Eastman Kodak (EK) gain 6.5% after stakeholder Investment Partners Asset Management...

    Shares of Eastman Kodak (EK) gain 6.5% after stakeholder Investment Partners Asset Management announces it send a letter to EK's board "imploring" the company to sell itself in its entirety. IPAM's Gregg Abella doesn't pull any punches: "In my opinion, Kodak's long-term performance is simply unacceptable, and as such it has not earned the right to remain an independent company."

     
     
     
     
    | 11:20 AM
  • BIDU

    Baidu (BIDU -9.4%) and Sina (SINA -13.1%) plunge on rumors the DOJ is investigating claims of...

    Baidu (BIDU -9.4%) and Sina (SINA -13.1%) plunge on rumors the DOJ is investigating claims of accounting fraud at the companies. Other Chinese Internet stocks are also getting hit: SOHU -9.4%. YOKU -14.5%. TUDO -5.9%. PWRD -3.8%. SNDA -3.8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:10 AM | 7 Comments
  • MIPS

    MIPS Technologies (MIPS -7%) is down after Benchmark cuts the shares to hold due to weak...

    MIPS Technologies (MIPS -7%) is down after Benchmark cuts the shares to hold due to weak consumer SoC sales and pressure on royalties from an economic slowdown.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:54 AM
  • THO

    Thor Industries (NYSE:THO), a maker of RVs and buses, gains 10.4% after reporting FQ4 revenue of...

    Thor Industries (NYSE:THO), a maker of RVs and buses, gains 10.4% after reporting FQ4 revenue of $770.5M (+16% Y/Y) and EPS of $0.66, beating consensus by $1.4M and $0.05. The company expects bus sales to get a lift in 2012 thanks to improving conditions in the public transportation market. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:49 AM
  • WYNN

    Shares of Wynn Resorts (NASDAQ:WYNN) fall sharply, down 8.2%, after initially bouncing higher on...

    Shares of Wynn Resorts (NASDAQ:WYNN) fall sharply, down 8.2%, after initially bouncing higher on the open after Citi raised its PT on shares by $7 to $140. It looks like Citi analyst Anil Daswani rained on the parade for the casino sector (BJK -1.8%) after cutting his own PT on MGM Resorts (MGM -6.6%) - due to loss in value of its stake in a Macau casino operator.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:37 AM | 2 Comments
  • NFLX

    It's still a momentum trade - to the downside. Netflix (NFLX -8.8%) sinks on no fresh news, but...

    It's still a momentum trade - to the downside. Netflix (NFLX -8.8%) sinks on no fresh news, but shares broke through $125 yesterday so now people want to dump them. Competition hurts: Amazon’s (NASDAQ:AMZN) new Kindle will let users stream movies, and Microsoft (NASDAQ:MSFT) will get some pay TV content from Comcast (NASDAQ:CMCSA) and Verizon (NYSE:VZ) streamed to its Xbox Live.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:37 AM
  • AMD

    Analysts aren't showing any mercy to AMD following yesterday's warning, as Longbow, ThinkEquity,...

    Analysts aren't showing any mercy to AMD following yesterday's warning, as Longbow, ThinkEquity, and Macquarie join BofA in downgrading the chipmaker. Oppenheimer is reiterating an Underperform, believing AMD's manufacturing issues have led it to lose ground to primary rivals INTC and NVDA. AMD -10.7%.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:32 AM
  • DVA

    Shares of DaVita (DVA -12%) get hit on a Citigroup downgrade to hold on valuation, citing new...

    Shares of DaVita (DVA -12%) get hit on a Citigroup downgrade to hold on valuation, citing new risk factors and uncertainty from recent legal issues in Colorado. Piper Jaffray is defending the shares however, saying the weakness has created a buying opportunity.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:28 AM
  • KFRC

    Shares of staffing companies are breaking out today on positive economic news, paced by a 6%...

    Shares of staffing companies are breaking out today on positive economic news, paced by a 6% jump in Kforce (NASDAQ:KFRC). It's welcome relief for a sector down 38% YTD as companies have been paring excess part-time workers. Gainers: MAN +3.9%, KELYA +5%, BBSI +5.8%, RHI +3.8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:12 AM

  • Shares of Edwards Lifesciences ([EW]] -7.8%) fall hard after Deutsche lowers its price target by...

    Shares of Edwards Lifesciences ([EW]] -7.8%) fall hard after Deutsche lowers its price target by $10 to $75 on "increased uncertainty on reimbursement and general market conditions." The firm maintains a Hold rating on the stock.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:56 AM
  • HOV

    Shares of Hovnanian (HOV +3.2%) climb after the home builder announces private offers to...

    Shares of Hovnanian (HOV +3.2%) climb after the home builder announces private offers to exchange notes for $220M of new 2% senior secured notes.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:42 AM
  • HGIC

    Nationwide Insurance buys Harleysville Group (NASDAQ:HGIC) for $60 a share, confirming a rumor...

    Nationwide Insurance buys Harleysville Group (NASDAQ:HGIC) for $60 a share, confirming a rumor reported last week. The $1.6B deal is expected to close in early 2012. Shares of HGIC skyrocket 85% on the news.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:34 AM
  • NOK

    Shares of Nokia (NYSE:NOK) gain 4% premarket after slashing jobs and operations costs. A...

    Shares of Nokia (NYSE:NOK) gain 4% premarket after slashing jobs and operations costs. A spokesman for the firm (video) says it will shift its focus to Asia to stay closer to its target market.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:00 AM
  • AEGN

    Insituform Technologies (INSU) drops 14.9% after the provider of infrastructure protection...

    Insituform Technologies (INSU) drops 14.9% after the provider of infrastructure protection technologies and services warns its 2011 EPS will be in a range of $0.90-$1.00, below a consensus of $1.19. The company blames weakness in both its Sewer Rehabilitation and Energy and Mining divisions.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:58 AM
  • CAT

    Shares of large-cap global machinery companies tip towards making a strong opening after...

    Shares of large-cap global machinery companies tip towards making a strong opening after positive news from Europe and the U.S. shades the outlook for the world economy more positive. Premarket: CAT +2.6%, JOY +4%, DE +2.7%.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:52 AM | 1 Comment
  • RAD

    Shares of Rite Aid (NYSE:RAD) gain 4% premarket after reporting September same store sales...

    Shares of Rite Aid (NYSE:RAD) gain 4% premarket after reporting September same store sales increased 1.3% compared to last year. Same store sales YTD increased 1.4%, consisting of a 1% front-end same store sales increase and a 1.6% increase in pharmacy same store sales.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:44 AM | 1 Comment
  • ANRZQ

    Coal stocks show some signs of life in premarket trading after suffering an extended beatdown...

    Coal stocks show some signs of life in premarket trading after suffering an extended beatdown (I, II), outpacing stock market futures. Gainers:  ANR +2.8%, PCX +4.2%, ANR +2.9%.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:36 AM
  • BDSI

    BioDelivery Sciences (NASDAQ:BDSI) drops 49% premarket after announcing preliminary results for...

    BioDelivery Sciences (NASDAQ:BDSI) drops 49% premarket after announcing preliminary results for a Phase 3 study for its BEMA Buprenorphine pain relief drug failed to report a difference in overall pain intensity between those taking the drug, and those taking a placebo.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:30 AM
  • AMD

    AMD catches a downgrade from BofA to Underperform from Neutral on the heels of its Q3 warning....

    AMD catches a downgrade from BofA to Underperform from Neutral on the heels of its Q3 warning. Analyst Vivek Arya slashed his PT on shares to $5, from $8, saying he preferred Buy-rated Intel (NASDAQ:INTC). Shares -10.8% premarket.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:22 AM
